main event: A bright orange, maneuverable object was observed near Maupin, Oregon on June 27, 1964.
interesting points: The object moved to the east, stopped, hovered, and then disappeared at a high rate of speed.
The object was observed through binoculars three times during the 2-minute sighting.
The report indicates there were insufficient details provided to fully evaluate the sighting.
No photographs were taken of the unidentified object.
The investigator, Capt. Donald Thorn, was unable to locate any permanent witnesses to the sighting.
